column4: hello, who can tell me how to prevent a program from accessing network on Ubuntu ?
That's what a firewall is used for (or just don't run or uninstall that program)
: can ufw block entire programs/process/child-processes ?
It doesn't block based on processes but rather what port they're talking on (which is usually as good)
: clock-applet, conky, and gweater are using port 80
what?
i can't reasonably block p.80
how sure are you?
: netstat -pn | grep tcp
good test...
Have you looked at nethogs  ?
It's used to see which processes are using network but I think it can block them too.   I probably shouldn't have to tell you that it is strange that the clock applet and conky are accessing port 80

just kill the processes  kill <pid>
